segments.text: I see the woman by the sink, so focused on drying that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She seems completely unaware of the water pouring over the edge.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the puddle forming at her feet, growing quickly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There’s something unsettling about how oblivious she is, almost like she’s in her own world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her dress and apron look so clean against the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the children’s antics are about to create a mess, and it’s hard not to feel anxious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on the stool is reaching for those cookies, balancing precariously.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but wonder if he’s going to fall and if she’ll even notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl beside him looks so expectant, like she’s in on some secret.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It feels like a moment suspended in time, playful yet fraught with danger.
segments.speaker: PAR
